body: These are implemented in terms of decode/encode CipherText. They do the exact same thing, since they are both simple length-prefixed byte arrays. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/257)

---

_[testing/hstox/binary_decode.c, line 9 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/257#-KW6zJATFcT353mnRYDR:-KW6zJAUJF5kjV9HH9XZ:b-bkeciw) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/c845a823ce12606230c94539bbb6b591dc095d9b/testing/hstox/binary_decode.c#L9)):_

> ``` C
> 
> 
> static void decode_bytestring(msgpack_object_bin args, msgpack_packer *res,
> ```

why are we breaking standard here, and using a 2nd function?

---

_Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/257)_

<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

Review status: 1 of 2 files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion. --- _[testing/hstox/binary_decode.c, line 9 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/257#-KW6zJATFcT353mnRYDR:-KWACxABloMw_iU-_Jz5:b5qhcf3) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/c845a823ce12606230c94539bbb6b591dc095d9b/testing/hstox/binary_decode.c#L9)):_
Previously, GrayHatter (Gregory Mullen) wrote… > why are we breaking standard here, and using a 2nd function? >
> I wasn't aware of such a standard. I think writing helper functions is fine, is it not? Either way, this function is necessary to avoid a large amount of duplication, because the only thing that differs between ciphertext and plaintext is the minimum length. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/257)_

Reviewed 1 of 1 files at r3. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion. --- _[testing/hstox/binary_decode.c, line 9 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/257#-KW6zJATFcT353mnRYDR:-KWAn4cXRb48WSXZjvtT:b-l2smyy) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/c845a823ce12606230c94539bbb6b591dc095d9b/testing/hstox/binary_decode.c#L9)):_
Previously, iphydf wrote… > I wasn't aware of such a standard. I think writing helper functions is fine, is it not? Either way, this function is necessary to avoid a large amount of duplication, because the only thing that differs between ciphertext and plaintext is the minimum length. >
> I'm fine with this from a code and style position. But I'm not convinced that it improves readability, and then why write use macros to generate functions if we're just going to write them on our own anyway? If you're okay with the extra check that's only needed half the time, It's not even an issue. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/257)_

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion, some commit checks failed. --- _[testing/hstox/binary_decode.c, line 9 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/257#-KW6zJATFcT353mnRYDR:-KWFZGEa78Bs93McDCgq:b-b86m53) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/c845a823ce12606230c94539bbb6b591dc095d9b/testing/hstox/binary_decode.c#L9)):_
Previously, GrayHatter (Gregory Mullen) wrote… > I'm fine with this from a code and style position. But I'm not convinced that it improves readability, and then why write use macros to generate functions if we're just going to write them on our own anyway? > > If you're okay with the extra check that's only needed half the time, It's not even an issue. >
> We use macros to generate function declarations for "methods". RPC method functions follow a very repetitive pattern that I wanted to factor out so we can focus on the implementation. I'm not sure what you mean by the second paragraph. Can you explain that further? --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/257)_

commit.message:
Add decode/encode PlainText test support.

These are implemented in terms of decode/encode CipherText. They do the
exact same thing, since they are both simple length-prefixed byte arrays.
